When a central bank implements QE, it buys financial assets such as government bonds, corporate bonds, or mortgage-backed securities from banks and other financial institutions, which injects money into the economy. This increase in the money supply is intended to lower interest rates, stimulate lending, and encourage investment and spending.

 

QE can also help to boost asset prices, such as stocks and real estate, which can increase household wealth and encourage consumer spending. Additionally, QE can help to increase inflation by encouraging borrowing and spending, which can support economic growth.

 

However, there are also potential risks associated with QE, such as inflationary pressures, asset price bubbles, and a potential increase in the risk-taking behaviour of financial institutions. Central banks typically use QE cautiously and in moderation to balance the benefits and risks of this policy tool.

Quiz Attempt #118985

Total Questions: 100
Question 1
Which one of the following non-tariff barriers is to be adequately addressed by India while signing FTA with any country that has potential to import fruits, vegetables and other plant-based products from India?
  • A.Phytosanitary Regulations
  • B.Sanitary Regulations
  • C.Complex Registrations
  • D.Restrictive customs procedure
Correct Answer: Phytosanitary Regulations

Option A is the correct answer.

 

Phytosanitary regulations are aimed at preventing the introduction and spread of pests and diseases that could harm crops, forests, and other plant life. They are designed to ensure that plant-based products being imported meet certain standards to prevent the introduction and spread of pests and diseases.

Question 2
According to theHeckscher-Ohlin theory, which one of the following statements is correct?
  • A.Trade should take place among countries that have greater differences in their factor endowments.
  • B.A country with a relatively cheaper cost of labour would export labour-intensive products.
  • C.Country benefits from international trade even if it is less efficient than other nations.
  • D.Countries with the proximity of geographical locations would have greater trade compared to the distant ones.
Correct Answer: Trade should take place among countries that have greater differences in their factor endowments.

The correct answer is A – Trade should take place among countries that have greater differences in their factor endowments.

 

The Heckscher-Ohlin theory, also known as the factor proportions theory, argues that international trade occurs between countries that have different factor endowments (e.g., labour, capital, and natural resources). According to this theory, a country will export goods that use its abundant factors of production and import goods that use its scarce factors of production. In other words, a country will specialize in the production of goods that it can produce most efficiently given its factor endowments.

 

Option B is partially correct as it explains the theory of comparative advantage, which states that a country should specialize in producing and exporting goods in which it has a lower opportunity cost and import goods in which it has a higher opportunity cost. If a country has a relatively cheaper cost of labor, it will have a comparative advantage in producing labor-intensive products.

 

Option C is incorrect as the Heckscher-Ohlin theory assumes that countries specialize in producing goods that they can produce efficiently given their factor endowments, and thus both countries can benefit from trade.

 

Option D is also incorrect as the Heckscher-Ohlin theory does not consider the geographic proximity of countries as a factor influencing trade. However, it is relevant in other theories such as the gravity model of trade.

Question 3
Which one of the following FTA was signed in February 2022 and came into force in May 2022?
  • A.AI-ECTA Australia - India Economic Cooperation and Trade Agreement
  • B.India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA)
  • C.India-Nepal Treaty of Trade
  • D.India-Singapore Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement (CECA)
Correct Answer: India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA)

Option B is the correct answer.

 

The India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) was signed between the two nations on 18th February 2022 and was entered into force on 01st May 2022. Government also flagged off the first consignment of goods comprising of Jewellery products from India to UAE under the India-UAE CEPA.

Question 4
The Government of India on 27-9-22 extended the existing Foreign Trade Policy (2015-20) up to which one of the following on account of volatile global economic and geo-political situation and currency fluctuations?
  • A.December 2022
  • B.March 2023
  • C.September 2023
  • D.December 2023
Correct Answer: March 2023

Government in September 2022 extended the FTP 2015 – 20 for a period of 6 months. Also on 31st March 2023, Government announced latest Foreign Trade Policy 2023.

Question 5
Which one of the followingIndAS is related to “The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates”?
  • A.IndAS 19
  • B.IndAS 115
  • C.IndAS 103
  • D.IndAS 21
Correct Answer: IndAS 21

The Ind AS related to "The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates" is Ind AS 21.

Question 6
Policy of ‘Playing Safe’ followed by the accountant is based on which one of the following concepts?
  • A.Dual Aspect Concept
  • B.Conservation Conventions
  • C.Money Measurement Concept
  • D.Realization Concept
Correct Answer: Conservation Conventions

The policy of ‘Playing Safe’ followed by accountants is based on the concept of Conservation Convention. The Conservation Convention requires accountants to be cautious and prudent when making accounting estimates and to recognize all possible losses, but to recognize gains only when they are certain. This policy presents a more conservative picture of the entity's financial position and performance. Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

Question 7
X and Y are partners in a firm sharing profits in the ratio 4:5. X surrenders 1/4 of his share and Y surrenders 1/5 of his share in favour of Z, the new partner. What will be the new profit-sharing ratio of the firm's partners?
  • A.3:4:2
  • B.55:44:81
  • C.4:5:2
  • D.44:55:81
Correct Answer: 3:4:2

X’s old share = 49

Share sacrificed in favour of Z = 49 × 14 = 19

X’s new share = 49 – 19 = 39

 

Y’s old share = 59

Share surrendered in favour of Z = 59 × 15 = 19

Y’s new share = 59 - 19 = 49

 

Z’s share = 19 + 19 = 29

 

New Profit-Sharing Ratio among X, Y and Z is 3:4:2.

Question 8
Net profit after taxes of a firm is Rs.1,00,000and its fixed interest charges on long term debt areRs. 20,000. What is the interest coverage ratio if the rate of income tax is 60%?
  • A.13 times
  • B.13.5 times
  • C.12.5 times
  • D.5 times
Correct Answer: 13.5 times

The interest coverage ratio measures the ability of a company to meet its interest obligations. It is calculated by dividing the earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) by the interest expense.

 

Interest Coverage Ratio = EBITInterest

 

Now, Earning after Tax (EAT) = EBIT – Interest – Tax

Therefore, EBIT = EAT + Interest + Tax

 

Or, EBIT = 1,00,000 + 20,000 + 60% of (EBIT – Interest)

 

Let EBIT be x, then the required equation will be: x = 1,20,000 + 60100 (x-20,000)

 

or x=2,70,000

 

Now, Interest Coverage Ratio = EBITInterest = 2,70,00020,000 = 13.5

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option B i.e., 13.5 times.

Question 9
The study of unemployment is the subject matter of which one of the following Economics?
  • A.Descriptive Economics
  • B.Normative Economics
  • C.Micro Economics
  • D.Macro Economics
Correct Answer: Macro Economics

The study of unemployment is the subject matter of Macro Economics.

Question 10
Which one of the following commodities has the most inelastic demand?
  • A.Cigarette
  • B.Soap
  • C.Ice-cream
  • D.Salt
Correct Answer: Salt

Option D is the correct answer.

 

Inelastic demand refers to a situation where a change in the price of a commodity leads to a relatively smaller change in the quantity demanded.

Question 11
India began laying the foundation for a more digital economy more than a decade ago with the launch of a national identification program calledAadhaar. The system creates biometric IDs to establish proof of residence and has been instrumental in digitizing financial transactions, among other benefits. This initiative is now part of India Stack, a decentralized public utility offering a low-cost comprehensive digital identity, payment and data management system. "IndiaStackis likely to lead to a massive change in how India spends, borrows and accesses healthcare", says an expert.IndiaStackhas broad applications including a network for lowering credit costs, making loans more accessible and affordable for both consumers and businesses. Credit availability is an important component of economic growth, and "India is currently one of the most under leveraged countries in the world", says the expert, whose team thinks the ratio of credit to GDP could increase from 57% to 100% over the next decade. Indian consumers are also likely to have more disposable income. India's income distribution could flip over the next decade, and consequently overall consumption in the country could be more than double from $2 trillion in 2022 to $4.9 trillion by the end of the decade - with the greatest gains going to non-grocery retail, including apparel and accessories, leisure and recreation, and household goods and services, among other categories.Given below are two statements:One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.Assertion ‘A’:India's income distribution could flip over the next decade.Reason ‘R’:Overall consumption in the country could be more than double from $2 trillion in 2022 to $4.9 trillion by the end of the decade.In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
  • B.Both A and R are true but R is not the correct explanation of A.
  • C.A is true but R is false.
  • D.A is false but R is true.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.

Both A and R are correct. The lines stating the explanation are:

 

“India's income distribution could flip over the next decade, and consequently overall consumption in the country could be more than double from $2 trillion in 2022 to $4.9 trillion by the end of the decade - with the greatest gains going to non-grocery retail, including apparel and accessories, leisure and recreation, and household goods and services, among other categories.”

Question 12
‘Sales Revenue Maximization’ as an alternate objective of business firms was postulated by whom of the following?
  • A.O.E. Williamson
  • B.Cyertand March
  • C.W.J.Baumol
  • D.K.W. Rothschild
Correct Answer: W.J.Baumol

The concept of Sales Revenue Maximization as an alternate objective of business firms was postulated by economist W.J. Baumol. In traditional economic theory, the objective of a firm is assumed to be profit maximization. However, Baumol argued that in certain situations, firms may aim to maximize their sales revenue instead of profits.

 

Baumol's theory suggests that firms may pursue sales revenue maximization as a strategic objective in situations where they are unable to accurately estimate costs or face uncertainty in the market. In such situations, firms may focus on increasing their sales revenue as a means of ensuring their survival and growth.

Question 13
Which one of the following statements is correct regarding the slope and the point elasticity on all the points on a rectangular hyperbola shaped demand curve of a product?
  • A.Slope remains the same while point elasticity goes on changing.
  • B.Slope goes on changing while point elasticity remains the same.
  • C.Both slope and point elasticity remain the same.
  • D.Both slope and point elasticity go on changing.
Correct Answer: Slope goes on changing while point elasticity remains the same.

The correct answer is B – Slope goes on changing while point elasticity remains the same.

 

On a rectangular hyperbola shaped demand curve of a product, the slope of the curve changes continuously as we move along the curve. This is because the slope of a hyperbola is steeper at the beginning and becomes flatter as we move along the curve towards the right.

 

However, the point elasticity at any given point on the curve remains the same. This is because the elasticity of demand at any given point on a hyperbola shaped demand curve is always equal to one (unit elasticity), regardless of the price or quantity demanded.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is B – Slope goes on changing while point elasticity remains the same.

Question 14
The current market price of a company’s share isRs. 90 and the expected dividend per share next year isRs. 4.50. If the dividends are expected to grow at a constant rate of 8%, the shareholders required rate of return is:
  • A.5%
  • B.8%
  • C.13%
  • D.20%
Correct Answer: 13%

To calculate the required rate of return, we can use the dividend discount model (DDM), which states that the current stock price is equal to the present value of all expected future dividends. The formula for the DDM is:

 

Stock price = Dividend / (Required rate of return - Dividend growth rate)

 

We are given that the current market price of the share is Rs. 90 and the expected dividend per share next year is Rs. 4.50. We are also given that the dividends are expected to grow at a constant rate of 8% per year.

 

Substituting these values into the DDM formula, we get:

90 = 4.5 / (r - 0.08)

Solving for r, we get:

r = 0.13 or 13%

 

Therefore, the shareholders’ required rate of return is 13%.

Question 15
The Kinked-shaped revenue curve of a firm relates to which one type of the market structure?
  • A.Perfect Competition
  • B.Oligopoly
  • C.Monopoly
  • D.Monopolistic Competition
Correct Answer: Oligopoly

The kinked-shaped revenue curve is a phenomenon that can occur in an oligopoly market structure where a few dominant firms have significant market power. The curve is based on the assumption that rivals will match price cuts but not price increases. As a result, the demand curve facing the firm is relatively elastic for price increases above the kink and relatively inelastic for price decreases below the kink, leading to a kink in the revenue curve.

 

In perfect competition, there are many small firms, and no individual firm has market power, so the kinked-shaped revenue curve is not applicable. In a monopoly, there is only one firm in the market, so there are no rivals to react to price changes. In monopolistic competition, there are many small firms, but they do not have significant market power, so the kinked-shaped revenue curve is also not applicable.

Question 16
‘Value-additivity principle’ implies in which one of the following methods of capital budgeting?
  • A.Payback period method
  • B.NPV method
  • C.IRR method
  • D.ARR method
Correct Answer: NPV method

The value-additivity principle is a fundamental principle in finance that states that the value of an asset is equal to the sum of the values of its cash flows. In the context of capital budgeting, this principle implies that the value of a project is equal to the sum of the values of its cash flows over the project's life.

 

The NPV (Net Present Value) method is based on the value-additivity principle and calculates the present value of all expected cash flows (both inflows and outflows) of a project discounted at the required rate of return. The NPV method compares the present value of the expected cash flows with the initial investment and accepts the project if the NPV is positive.

 

The payback period method does not consider the time value of money and only calculates the time taken to recover the initial investment. The IRR (Internal Rate of Return) method also considers the time value of money but does not always lead to the same accept/reject decision as the NPV method. The ARR (Accounting Rate of Return) method focuses on the accounting income of the project and does not consider the time value of money.

Question 17
The risk-free rate is 6 per cent, the market risk premium is 9 per cent and the beta of share is 1.54, then what is cost of equity?
  • A.23%
  • B.19%
  • C.13%
  • D.20%
Correct Answer: 20%

The cost of equity can be calculated using the capital asset pricing model (CAPM), which relates the required rate of return on a stock to its risk and the market's risk. The CAPM formula is:

Cost of equity = Risk-free rate + Beta × (Market risk premium)

We are given that the risk-free rate is 6%, the market risk premium is 9%, and the beta of the share is 1.54.

 

Substituting these values into the CAPM formula, we get:

Cost of equity = 6% + 1.54 × 9%

Cost of equity = 6% + 13.86%

Cost of equity = 19.86%

Therefore, the correct answer is D 20%, which is the closest available option to 19.86%.

Question 18
While averaging rates and ratios where time factor is variable and the act being performed is constant, which one of the following measures of Central Tendency is appropriate?
  • A.Arithmetic Average
  • B.Mode
  • C.Harmonic Mean
  • D.Geometric Mean
Correct Answer: Harmonic Mean

The harmonic mean is the appropriate measure of central tendency when rates and ratios with variable time factors and constant act being performed are averaged. This is because the harmonic mean gives more weight to smaller values and less weight to larger values. In the context of rates and ratios, this means that the harmonic mean gives more weight to slower rates and lower ratios, which are often more relevant in certain applications such as speed, time, and distance problems.

 

For example, when calculating the average speed of a trip with variable speeds but a constant distance, the harmonic mean would be the appropriate measure of central tendency.

 

The arithmetic mean is the most commonly used measure of central tendency, but it does not account for the variable time factor in rates and ratios. The mode is not appropriate for averaging rates and ratios, as it only describes the most common value in a set of data. The geometric mean is appropriate when values are multiplied together, but not for averaging rates and ratios.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is C – Harmonic mean.

Question 19
If two regression coefficients are 0.8 and 1.2, which one of the following is the value of coefficient of correlation?
  • A.0.97
  • B.0.96
  • C.1.00
  • D.0.80
Correct Answer: 0.97

The coefficient of correlation is the GM between the regression coefficients.

 

Thus, coefficient of correlation = 0.8×1.2 = 0.9797

 

The sign of coefficient of correlation will be same as sign of regression coefficients.

Question 20
Which one of the following statements is true?
  • A.For a symmetrical distributionβ1= 0.
  • B.Kurtosis means ‘lack of symmetry’.
  • C.β2canbe negative.
  • D.Skewness studies the flatness orpeakednessof the distribution.
Correct Answer: For a symmetrical distributionβ1= 0.

A measure of kurtosis indicates the degree to which a curve of the frequency distribution is peaked or flat-topped. Hence statement B is wrong. ‘lack of symmetry’ is definition of Skewness.

Kurtosis studies the flatness or peakedness of the distribution and not Skewness. Hence statement D is wrong.

 

Yes, β2 can be negative. β2 is a measure of Kurtosis.

 

For a symmetrical distribution β1 = 0. Here β1 is measure of skewness. Hence A is True.

β2 can not be negative. The smallest possible kurtosis is 1 (excess kurtosis −2), and the largest is ∞. Hence C is wrong.

Question 21
Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
  • A.Algebraic sum of deviations taken from Arithmetic Mean is zero.
  • B.The sum of absolute deviations taken from Median is the largest.
  • C.Standard deviation is always less than range.
  • D.The sum of the squares of deviations of a given set of observations is minimum, when taken about the arithmetic mean.
Correct Answer: The sum of absolute deviations taken from Median is the largest.

The sum of absolute deviations taken from Median is the minimum and not largest. Hence B is incorrect. Remaining three options are correct.

Question 22
Which one of the following is referent source of power?
  • A.Perception or belief that the manager has some special knowledge.
  • B.Manager’s desire to identify with or imitate the subordinate.
  • C.Ability of the manager to reward the subordinate for obeying orders.
  • D.Ability of the manager to punish the subordinate for not obeying orders.
Correct Answer: Manager’s desire to identify with or imitate the subordinate.

Option B is the correct answer.

 

Referent Power is a type of power that is based on the degree to which a subordinate perceives that the manager is likeable, respectable, and admirable. This power source is based on the subordinate’s identification with the manager, and the subordinate may seek to imitate the manager's behaviour, beliefs, or values. This source of power is based on the personal relationship between the manager and the subordinate, rather than on any specific actions the manager may take.

Question 23
Which one of the following is NOT an advantage of the line organization?
  • A.It ensures excellent discipline.
  • B.It fixes responsibility for the performance of tasks.
  • C.It is suitable for big organizations.
  • D.It is not expensive.
Correct Answer: It is suitable for big organizations.

Option C is the correct answer.

 

The line organization is a type of organizational structure where authority flows in a straight line from the top level of management to the bottom level. This type of organization is suitable for small organizations where there is a clear chain of command and decision-making is centralized.

 

However, in big organizations, the line organization may not be suitable because it can lead to bureaucracy, delays in decision-making, and lack of flexibility. Large organizations usually require more specialized departments and teams, and the line organization may not allow for the necessary cross-functional collaboration and coordination. Additionally, a large number of employees in a line organization can result in a longer chain of command, leading to slower communication and decision-making.

Question 24
A scale that measures a fair sample of the tasks and skills actually needed for the job in question is known as:
  • A.Test validity
  • B.Criterion validity
  • C.Content validity
  • D.Construct validity
Correct Answer: Content validity

The scale that measures a fair sample of the tasks and skills actually needed for the job in question is known as content validity. Therefore, the answer is C – Content validity.

 

Test validity refers to the overall effectiveness of a test in measuring what it is intended to measure, regardless of the specific content of the test.

 

Criterion validity refers to the degree to which a test score can be used to predict job performance or some other relevant criterion.

 

Construct validity refers to the degree to which a test measures the theoretical construct or trait it is designed to measure.

Question 25
Training technique which teaches the importance of resolving matters is known as:
  • A.Built-in-Tension
  • B.Shadowing
  • C.Tag Teams
  • D.Mirroring
Correct Answer: Built-in-Tension

Option A is the correct answer.

 

Built-in-Tension is the training technique that teaches the importance of resolving matters. This technique involves creating a scenario or situation where there is a conflict or tension between two or more individuals, and the participants are required to work together to resolve the issue. The purpose of this technique is to help participants develop their conflict resolution skills and learn how to work collaboratively to reach a mutually beneficial solution.

Question 26
When Central Bank conducts a sale of securities, the cash reserve of commercial banks shall:
  • A.Increase at slow rate
  • B.Decrease
  • C.Remain constant
  • D.Increase at fast rate
Correct Answer: Decrease

When a central bank conducts a sale of securities, it means that it is selling government securities or bonds to the market participants such as commercial banks, investment banks, or individual investors. In exchange for these securities, the central bank receives cash from the buyers.

 

When commercial banks purchase government securities from the central bank, they pay for these securities by drawing down their reserve accounts with the central bank. A reserve account is an account that commercial banks are required to maintain with the central bank, and it represents the funds that the bank holds in reserve to meet the demands of their depositors.

 

When a bank’s reserve account is reduced as a result of purchasing government securities, its cash reserves decrease. This is because the reserve account is essentially a cash balance that the bank holds with the central bank, and the purchase of securities with this balance means that the cash is transferred out of the bank's reserve account to the central bank.

 

A reduction in a bank's cash reserves can impact its ability to lend and create new deposits. Banks use their reserve accounts to meet the cash demands of their depositors, so a decrease in cash reserves could make it more difficult for the bank to meet these demands. As a result, the bank may be more cautious about lending, which could lead to a reduction in the money supply.

Question 27
‘Average clause’ in insurance is applicable for which one of the following cases?
  • A.Double Insurance
  • B.Re-insurance
  • C.Over insurance
  • D.Under insurance
Correct Answer: Under insurance

The correct answer is option D i.e., Under insurance.

 

The “average clause” in insurance is a provision that applies when the insured has not insured the full value of the property. It allows the insurance company to reduce the amount of the claim in proportion to the under-insurance.

 

For example, let's say that a person insures their house for Rs. 50 lakhs, but the actual value of the house is Rs. 75 lakhs. If the house is damaged in a fire and the cost to repair the damage is Rs. 10 lakhs, the insurance company would only pay out 2/3 of the claim (i.e., Rs. 6.67 lakh) because the insured was under-insured by 1/3.

 

The purpose of the average clause is to encourage the insured to insure their property for its full value, and to prevent them from taking out insurance for a lower amount and paying lower premiums. This ensures that the insurance company receives adequate compensation for the risks it is undertaking, and that the insured is adequately protected in the event of a loss.

Question 28
ABC Ventures is private equity investor considering investingRs. 1,000 million in the equity of XYZ ltd. ABC Ventures requires a return of 30% on investment with planned holding period of 5 years. The likely debt of XYZ ltd. will beRs. 1000 million and cash balance ofRs. 300 million with a projected EBITDA ofRs. 1500 million for the year 5. The desired ownership share of ABC Ventures in XYZ ltd., givenFVF0.30,5= 3.713, will be:
  • A.37.13%
  • B.30.00%
  • C.37.90%
  • D.7.13%
Correct Answer: 37.90%

Value of Firm = Value of Debt + Value of equity

 

Value of debt is given Rs. 1000 million

 

Value of equity = EBITA/ ke + Cash = 15003,713 ×0.30 + 300 = 1646.6

 

Value of the firm = 1000 + 1646.6 = 2646.6

 

Ownership share of ABC = 10002646.6 × 100 = 37.78%

Question 29
One of the assumptions in Black-Scholes Option Pricing Model is that underlying asset prices are:
  • A.Equi-distributed
  • B.Marginally distributed
  • C.Log-normally distributed
  • D.Normally distributed
Correct Answer: Log-normally distributed

The Black-Scholes option pricing model is a mathematical formula used to price European-style options, which are options that can only be exercised on the expiration date. This model is based on several assumptions, one of which is that the underlying asset prices follow a log-normal distribution.

 

A log-normal distribution is a probability distribution of a random variable whose logarithm is normally distributed. In other words, if we take the natural logarithm of the prices of an asset, the resulting distribution of log prices should follow a normal distribution.

 

The Black-Scholes model assumes that the underlying asset prices are log-normally distributed because it allows for the modelling of asset prices that have a positive skewness, which is often observed in financial markets. Skewness refers to the degree of asymmetry in the distribution of a variable. In financial markets, asset prices often have a tendency to rise more than they fall, leading to a positively skewed distribution.

 

By assuming that asset prices follow a log-normal distribution, the Black-Scholes model can account for this skewness and accurately price options that have both upside and downside risk. The log-normal distribution also allows for the calculation of the expected value and variance of the underlying asset price, which are necessary inputs for the Black-Scholes formula.

Question 30
In which one of the following service products, price sensitivity of the customers is low?
  • A.Car rentals
  • B.Transport
  • C.Medical services
  • D.Retailing
Correct Answer: Medical services

The answer is C - Medical services.

 

Price sensitivity of customers is generally low when it comes to medical services, as customers prioritize their health and well-being over price. In such cases, customers are willing to pay higher prices to receive quality medical care.

Question 31
Which one of the following is correct while segmenting consumer markets on demographic basis?
  • A.Low predictability of consumer choice behaviour and high cost of measurement.
  • B.Low predictability of consumer choice behaviour and low cost of measurement.
  • C.High predictability of consumer choice behaviour and low cost of measurement.
  • D.High predictability of consumer choice behaviour and high cost of measurement.
Correct Answer: Low predictability of consumer choice behaviour and low cost of measurement.

Demographic segmentation involves dividing the market on the basis of demographic variables such as age, gender, income, education, occupation, etc. This type of segmentation is based on the assumption that people in the same demographic group have similar needs and wants that will influence their purchasing habits.

 

The advantage of demographic segmentation is that it is easy to collect. Government sources, including the Bureau of Labour Standards, provide household, income, education, and health data for marketing strategy and business goals. Companies have also developed apps that track more granular demographic data for contact tracing and travel patterns. Surveys also reveal the specific demographics of a target market instead of available research data sources and uncover actionable insights.

Question 32
Which one of the following is NOT a market-oriented definition of a business?
  • A.We run a railroad.
  • B.We help improve office productivity.
  • C.We supply energy.
  • D.We distribute information.
Correct Answer: We run a railroad.

We run a railroad is not a market-oriented definition of a business, as it focuses on the internal operations of the business rather than the products or services it offers to the market. The other options (B, C, and D) describe the products or services that the business offers to the market and are market-oriented definitions.

Question 33
In which one of the following concepts, a buyer is passively involved in an exchange transaction, and he accepts whatever is offered to him by a marketer?
  • A.Production concept
  • B.Product concept
  • C.Selling concept
  • D.Marketing concept
Correct Answer: Production concept

The Production concept of marketing is a business orientation that focuses on achieving high production efficiency and low costs. The key assumption behind this concept is that consumers will favour products that are widely available and affordable. This concept was popular during the Industrial Revolution when mass production techniques allowed manufacturers to produce goods in large quantities at low cost.

Question 34
If invoice discounting is not confidential in nature, the customers of the client are advised to make payment directly to the factor. This facility, when offered with a non-recourse, is known as:
  • A.Agency Factoring
  • B.Protected invoice discounting
  • C.Full factoring
  • D.Odd line factoring
Correct Answer: Agency Factoring

Agency Factoring is a type of factoring where the factor (the financing company) acts as an agent of the client (the business selling the invoice) to collect payments from the client's customers on behalf of the client.

Question 35
The practice of forging a return address on an e-mail so that the recipient is fooled into revealing private information is termed as:
  • A.Hacking
  • B.Cracking
  • C.Dumpster diving
  • D.Spoofing
Correct Answer: Spoofing

Spoofing is a technique used by attackers to forge the return address on an email to make it appear as if it has been sent from a trustworthy source. The goal of email spoofing is to trick the recipient into believing that the message is legitimate, in order to obtain sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, credit card details, or other private information.

 

Spoofing can also be used in phishing attacks, where attackers try to lure victims into clicking on a malicious link or downloading a malicious attachment by posing as a reputable organization or a trusted individual.

 

In contrast, hacking and cracking generally refer to unauthorized access to computer systems or networks. Dumpster diving involves searching through discarded materials to find sensitive or valuable information.

Question 36
If anyone fraudulently or dishonestly makes use of the electronic signature, password or any other unique identification feature of any other person, then under which section of IT Act 2000, punishment shall be given?
  • A.Section 63
  • B.Section 66B
  • C.Section 66C
  • D.Section 67B
Correct Answer: Section 66C

Option C is the correct answer.

 

Section 66C of the said Act read as follows.

 

Punishment for identity theft - Whoever, fraudulently or dishonestly make use of the electronic signature, password or any other unique identification feature of any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine with may extend to rupees one lakh.

Question 37
From Dec. 1, 2022 which body handles all complaints related to Profiteering under Goods and Services Tax (GST)?
  • A.National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA)
  • B.NITIAayog
  • C.Competition Commission of India (CCI)
  • D.GST Council
Correct Answer: Competition Commission of India (CCI)

Profiteering watchdog under Goods & Services Tax (GST) regime, National Anti-Profiteering Authority has ceased to exist from December 1, 2022. All profiteering related matter are now be examined by Competition Commission of India.

Question 38
Section 80 GGC of Income Tax Act is related with which one of the following?
  • A.Deduction in respect of contribution given by any company to political parties.
  • B.Deduction in respect of contribution given by any person to political parties.
  • C.Deduction in respect of rent paid.
  • D.Deduction in respect of certain donation for scientific research.
Correct Answer: Deduction in respect of contribution given by any person to political parties.

Section 80GGB & 80GGC – in respect of contributions given to political parties or electoral trust:

 

This section provides for deduction of any sum contributed in the previous year by an Indian company (section 80GGB) and by any person (section 80 GGC) to any political party or an electoral trust. However, no deduction shall be allowed in respect of any sum contributed by way of cash. The deduction is not available to a local authority and every artificial juridical person wholly or partly funded by the Government. From AY 2014-15, no deduction shall be allowed in respect of any contribution (which is given in cash) to a political party.

Question 39
Which one of the following is NOT correct for Tonnage Tax System?
  • A.It is a scheme of presumptive taxation.
  • B.It is applicable for the taxation of income derived from shipping activities.
  • C.It is applicable for both Indian as well as foreign companies.
  • D.Computation of tonnage income is covered U/S 115 VG.
Correct Answer: It is applicable for both Indian as well as foreign companies.

In case of a company, the income from the business of operating qualifying ships, may, at its option, be computed in accordance with the provisions of Chapter XII-G of the Income Tax Act. 1961. Thus, tonnage taxation is a scheme of presumptive taxation wherein notional income arising from operation of ships is determined on basis of tonnage of ships. Computation of tonnage income is covered U/S 115 VG. Therefore, option A, B and D are correct.

 

Under a Tonnage Tax System, a company is a qualifying company if—

(a) it is an Indian company;

(b) the place of effective management of the company is in India;

(c) it owns at least one qualifying ship; and

(d) the main object of the company is to carry on the business of operating ships.

 

Therefore, option C is incorrect for Tonnage Tax System.

Question 40
Tax on declared dividend is paid by whom?
  • A.Shareholders/ Receiver of the dividend
  • B.Manager
  • C.Distributor of the dividend
  • D.Company
Correct Answer: Shareholders/ Receiver of the dividend

With effect from Assessment Year 2021-22, the domestic company isn’t required to pay dividend distribution tax (DDT) on any amount declared, distributed or paid by such company by way of dividend.

 

Dividend received from domestic company is taxable in hands of shareholders.

Question 41
Which one of the following is NOT related to Income Tax in India?
  • A.Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)
  • B.Dearness Allowance (DA)
  • C.Leave Travel Allowance (LTA)
  • D.Tax Deduction and Collection Account Number (TAN)
Correct Answer: Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)

Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) is not related to Income Tax in India.

 

TIN or Taxpayer Identification Number is an 11-digit numeric code which is mandatory for traders or dealers who participate in transactions which attract VAT. All businesses which participate in interstate trade are expected to have a TIN. A TIN is often called the VAT Number or Sales Tax Number.

 

The TIN replaced the Sales Tax numbers or CST numbers issued by the State Sales Tax Authorities. The TIN, VAT number or CST number are all the same, and it is mandatory to mention the TIN while undertaking inter-state or state-level sales. All businesses and dealers must mention their TIN in all their sales and purchases of goods and services between states or inside a state.

Question 42
After COVID-19, which of the following are the upskilling enablers for women in India?A. Introduction of electric vehicles.B. Flexible work opportunities.C. Work from home.D. Need to stay relevant, especially in technology.E. Willingness to return to work.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.B, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C, D and E only

After COVID-19, the following are the upskilling enablers for women in India:

(i) Flexible work opportunities.

(ii) Work from home.

(iii) Need to stay relevant, especially in technology.

(iv) Willingness to return to work.

 

Hence, option D is correct.

Question 43
E-commerce and large retailers in India bet big on mega consumption events on which of the following days?A. Republic DayB. Independence DayC. Black FridayD. Cyber MondayE.AkshyaTritiyaChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.A, B and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

E-commerce and large retailers in India bet big on mega consumption events on several days throughout the year, including Republic Day, Independence Day, Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Akshaya Tritiya.

 

Republic Day and Independence Day are two of the most significant national holidays in India, and retailers often offer sales and discounts to attract customers. Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which originated in the United States but have since gained popularity worldwide, are also widely observed by Indian e-commerce companies and retailers, who offer deep discounts on a range of products.

 

Akshaya Tritiya, a Hindu festival that falls in the month of April or May, is also a popular day for shopping, particularly for gold and other precious items, as it is believed to bring good luck and prosperity.

Question 44
Which of the following are NOT assumptions of Marginal Costing?A. The total cost can be segregated into fixed and variable components.B. Fixed costs per unit of production remains constant.C. Variable cost remains constant per unit of output.D. The selling price per unit remains unchanged.E. Variable cost is variable per unit.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B and E only
  • C.C and D only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: B and E only

The assumptions of marginal costing are:

(i) The total cost can be segregated into fixed and variable components. (Statement A is correct).

(ii) Fixed costs remain constant, irrespective of Volume. Hence Statement B is incorrect.

(iii) Variable costs vary proportionally with the level of output. But Variable cost remains constant per unit of output. (Statement C is correct and Statement E is incorrect)

(iv) The selling price per unit remains constant (Statement D is correct).

 

Hence, correct answer is B.

Question 45
Which of the following transactions are related to Financing Activities?a. Share issued for cashb. Dividend distributed to shareholdersc. Sale of machineryd. Redemption of debenturese. Provision for depreciationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a and e only
  • B.a and c only
  • C.a, b and d only
  • D.a, b, c and d only
Correct Answer: a, b and d only

Financing activities relate to long-term funds or capital of an enterprise, e.g., cash proceeds from issue of equity shares, debentures, raising long-term bank loans, repayment of bank loan, etc. As per AS-3, financing activities are activities that result in changes in the size and composition of the owners’ capital (including preference share capital in case of a company) and borrowings of the enterprise. Separate disclosure of cash flows arising from financing activities is important because it is useful in predicting claims on future cash flows by providers of funds (both capital and borrowings) to the enterprise.

 

Examples of financing activities are as follows.

 

Cash Inflows from financing activities

Cash proceeds from issuing shares (equity or/and preference).

Cash proceeds from issuing debentures, loans, bonds and other short/ long-term borrowings.

 

Cash Outflows from financing activities

Cash repayments of amounts borrowed.

Interest paid on debentures and long-term loans and advances.

Dividends paid on equity and preference capital.

 

In the given options, the treatment of transactions will be as follows.

Share issued for cash - This transaction involves the issuance of new equity shares in exchange for cash, which is a source of funds for the company. Hence, it is a financing activity.

 

Dividend distributed to shareholders - This transaction involves the distribution of profits to the shareholders in the form of dividends, which is a repayment of funds to the shareholders. It is a financing activity.

 

Sale of machinery - This transaction is not related to financing activities, as it involves the sale of a fixed asset and the proceeds from the sale are considered as cash inflow from investing activities.

 

Redemption of debentures - This transaction involves the repayment of debt instruments, which is a repayment of funds to the debenture holders. It is a financing activity.

 

Provision for depreciation - This transaction is not related to financing activities, as it does not involve any inflow or outflow of cash.

 

Therefore, option C is correct.

Question 46
Which of the following statements are correct?A. A monopolist can charge any price to maximize profits.B. The slope of monopoly's MR curve is twice that of AR curve.C. A necessary condition for monopoly's long-run equilibrium is AC = AR = MC = MR.D. A monopolist is in equilibrium where MC = MR.E. Equilibrium price of a monopolist is always higher than that of a competitive firm.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.B, D and E only
  • D.C, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, D and E only

Statement A is incorrect because, the monopolist’s price is limited by consumer demand. So charging the highest possible price may not be consistent with maximizing profit.

 

 

Statement C is incorrect. In the long run, MR=MC and Price=Demand=AC. But All of them are not equal.

Question 47
Which of the following factors hinder the formation and sustainability of Cartels?a. Less number of firms in the industry.b. Presence of differentiated products.c. Different cost structures.d. Low frequency sales coupled with huge amounts of output.e. Absence of monopolies and restrictive trade practices.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.b, c and d only
  • B.a, d and e only
  • C.c, d and e only
  • D.b, c and e only
Correct Answer: b, c and d only

Cartels are formed by a group of firms in an industry with the aim of reducing competition among themselves and increasing their collective profits. However, there are several factors that can hinder the formation and sustainability of cartels.

 

a. Less number of firms in the industry - This can actually facilitate the formation and sustainability of cartels as there are fewer firms to coordinate with and it's easier to control the market.

b. Presence of differentiated products - This factor hinders the formation and sustainability of cartels because it's harder to coordinate prices and output when products are different.

c. Different cost structures - This factor also hinders the formation and sustainability of cartels because firms may have different production costs, making it harder to agree on a common price and output level.

d. Low frequency sales coupled with huge amounts of output - Low frequency sales coupled with huge amounts of output make it difficult for firms to coordinate their production decisions. Hence, this factor hinders the formation and sustainability of cartels.

e. Absence of monopolies and restrictive trade practices - When a market is competitive and there are no monopolies, firms may find it difficult to earn profits due to price competition. In such a scenario, firms may come together to form a cartel, which allows them to collectively act as a monopolist and charge higher prices. The absence of monopolies in the market makes it easier for cartels to sustain their prices, as there is no threat of new entrants disrupting the market.

 

Similarly, the absence of restrictive trade practices, such as antitrust laws, may also contribute to the formation and growth of cartels. Without laws that regulate collusion and price-fixing, firms may be more likely to engage in such practices. This can allow them to collectively exert more control over the market and charge higher prices.

 

Therefore, options (b), (c), and (d) are the correct answers as they all hinder the formation and sustainability of cartels.

Question 48
Which of the following factors determine the requirements of working capital of a firm?a. Nature of Businessb. Technology and Manufacturing Policyc. Management Skillsd. Credit Policye. Market and Demand ConditionsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a, b, c and d only
  • B.a, b, d, and e only
  • C.c, d and e only
  • D.a, b and e only
Correct Answer: a, b, d, and e only

Working capital is the amount of funds that a company needs to maintain its day-to-day operations. The requirements of working capital depend on various factors, and among the given options, the following factors determine the requirements of working capital of a firm:

 

Nature of Business: Different types of businesses have different working capital requirements. For example, a manufacturing company requires more working capital than a service company.

 

Technology and Manufacturing Policy: The type of technology used by a company and its manufacturing policy can affect its working capital requirements. For example, a company that uses expensive machinery will require more working capital.

 

Credit Policy: A company's credit policy can affect its working capital requirements. For example, if a company has a liberal credit policy, it will require more working capital to maintain its operations.

 

Market and Demand Conditions: The market and demand conditions can also affect a company's working capital requirements. For example, if the demand for a company's products is high, it may require more working capital to increase production.

 

Therefore, options a, b, d, and e are the correct options as they include the factors that determine the requirements of working capital of a firm.

Question 49
Which of the following are related to primary capital market?a. IPOb. Long Term Loansc. Venture Capitald. Letters of Credite. Participation CertificatesChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.a, b and e only
  • B.c, d and e only
  • C.a, b and c only
  • D.a, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and c only

The most appropriate answer is option (C) - a, b, and c only

 

a. IPO (Initial Public Offering) is related to the primary capital market as it involves the first sale of shares by a company to the public.

 

b. Long Term Loans can be associated with the primary capital market, as companies often raise funds through long-term loans when they are initially establishing or expanding their operations.

 

c. Venture Capital is also related to the primary capital market. Venture capitalists provide funding to Startups and small businesses in exchange for equity ownership or other forms of investment.

 

d. Letters of Credit are typically associated with trade finance and are more related to the secondary capital market.

 

e. Participation Certificates are financial instruments associated with the primary capital market, as they represent ownership in specific projects or investments.

Question 50
Which among the following are the measures of Central Tendency or Measures of Location?A. MeanB. RangeC. ModeD. MedianE. VarianceChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C and E only
  • B.C, D and E only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

The measures of central tendency or measures of location are statistical measures that provide a single value that is representative of a set of data.

 

The following options are the measures of central tendency:

A. Mean - The arithmetic mean or average is the sum of all values in a set of data divided by the number of values. It is commonly used to represent the typical value of a set of data.

 

C. Mode - The mode is the value that occurs most frequently in a set of data. It is used to represent the most common value in a set of data.

 

D. Median - The median is the value that separates the higher half from the lower half of a set of data. It is used to represent the middle value in a set of data.

 

Therefore, the correct options are A, C, and D.

 

B. Range and E. Variance – are measures of dispersion, which describe the spread or variability of the data.

Question 51
In which of the following practical situations, Poisson Distribution can be used?A. Number of customers arriving at the super markets per hour.B. Number of typographical errors per page in a typed material.C. Number of accidents taking place per day on a busy road.D. Dice throwing problems.E. Number of defective material say, blades, etc. in a packing manufactured by a good concern.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, D and E only
  • B.A, B, C and E only
  • C.A, C, D and E only
  • D.A, B, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and E only

Poisson Distribution is a probability distribution that is used to model the number of events occurring in a fixed interval of time or space when the events occur independently and at a constant average rate.

 

The following practical situations can be modelled using Poisson Distribution:

A. Number of customers arriving at the supermarkets per hour.

B. Number of typographical errors per page in a typed material.

C. Number of accidents taking place per day on a busy road.

E. Number of defective material say, blades, etc. in a packing manufactured by a good concern.

 

Therefore, the correct options are A, B, C, and E.

 

Option D: Dice throwing problems, on the other hand, are usually modelled using the discrete uniform distribution, as each face of the die has an equal probability of being obtained.

Question 52
Which of the following attributes are true in systems approach to Performance Appraisal?A. Low degree of formality.B. Occasional appraisal frequency.C. Individual-oriented reward practices.D. Facilitative leadership practices.E. Problem solving as primary goal.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, D and E only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.B, C and E only
  • D.A, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, D and E only

The most appropriate answer is option A – A, D, and E only.

 

The systems approach to performance appraisal is a comprehensive approach that considers the entire organizational system when evaluating employee performance.

Question 53
Which of the following are the distinct features of the Principles of Management?A. FlexibilityB. Universal application.C. Principles are absolute, not relative.D. Based on situation.E. Derived out of experience.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C and E only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.B, C, D and E only
  • D.A, B, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E only

Except C, all are statements are correct in relation to Principles of Management.

 

A. Flexibility – The principles of management are flexible and can be modified according to the changing needs of the organization.

 

B. Universal Application – The principles of management are applicable to all types of organizations, irrespective of their size, nature, or location.

 

C. Principles are absolute, not relative – This statement is incorrect. The principles of management are relative and not absolute as they can change according to the situation.

 

D. Based on situation – The principles of management are not fixed and can vary according to the situation or context in which they are applied.

 

E. Derived out of experience – The principles of management are derived from the experience of successful managers and are based on empirical observation rather than theoretical constructs.

Question 54
According to Henri Fayol, which of the following are the Principles of Management?A. DisciplineB. DecentralizationC. Unity of CommandD. EquityE. Instability of TenureChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C, D only
  • B.A, B, C, E only
  • C.A, B, D only
  • D.B, C, E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D only

Option A is the correct answer.

 

Henri Fayol identified 14 Principles of Management in his book "General and Industrial Management" published in 1916. The five principles listed in the options are:

 

A. Discipline: Fayol believed that discipline was essential for any organization to function effectively.

 

B. Decentralization: Decentralization is not one of Fayol's Principles of Management. However, he did believe that delegation was important, and that authority should be decentralized to some extent.

 

C. Unity of Command: Fayol believed that each employee should have only one boss, which is the principle of unity of command.

 

D. Equity: Fayol believed that managers should treat their subordinates with kindness and justice, which is the principle of equity.

 

E. Instability of Tenure: Fayol believed that stability of tenure was important to ensure the smooth functioning of an organization, and instability of tenure is not one of his principles.

Question 55
Which of the following are the functions of Reserve Bank of India?A. Issue of CurrencyB. Accepting DepositsC. Banker of GovernmentD. Bankers BankE. Credit ControlChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B and C only
  • B.A and D only
  • C.A, B, C and D only
  • D.A, C, D, and E only
Correct Answer: A, C, D, and E only

Except B, all other statements are the functions of RBI.

Question 56
For ongoing maintenance of regulatory capital, which of the following risks were covered by Pillar-1 Minimum Capital Requirement?A. Credit RiskB. Financial riskC. Operation RiskD. Market RiskE. Reputational RiskChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.B, C and D only
  • D.A, C and D only
Correct Answer: A, C and D only

Basel regulation has evolved to comprise three pillars concerned with minimum capital requirements (Pillar 1), supervisory review (Pillar 2), and market discipline (Pillar 3). Today, the regulation applies to credit risk, market risk, operational risk and liquidity risk.

 

Pillar I: Minimum Capital Requirements - Maintains minimum regulatory capital calculated for credit risk, operational risk and market risk to align more closely to the bank’s actual risk of economic loss.

 

Pillar II: Supervisory review - Evaluates activities and risk profiles by supervisors to determine if the banks should hold higher levels of capital than the minimum requirements in Pillar I and if further actions are required.

 

Pillar III: Market Discipline - Leverages the ability of market discipline to motivate prudent management by enhancing the degree of transparency in the banks’ public reporting to shareholders and customers.

Question 57
Which of the following are the advantages of Mobile Banking?A. InsecureB. Fraud reductionC. Time savingD. Separate internet requiredE. Increased efficiencyChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, C and E only
  • B.A, B and D only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.B, D and E only
Correct Answer: B, C and E only

Mobile banking has several advantages, as follows:

 

1. Fraud reduction: Mobile banking apps typically use advanced security measures such as encryption and biometric authentication to protect user data and transactions. This makes it more difficult for fraudsters to access and misuse the user's banking information.

 

2. Time saving: Mobile banking allows users to access banking services and perform transactions from anywhere, at any time, as long as they have an internet connection. This eliminates the need to visit a physical bank branch, saving time and effort.

 

3. Increased efficiency: Mobile banking apps offer a wide range of services, including fund transfers, bill payments, balance checks, loan applications, and investment services. This provides users with more control over their finances and enables them to manage their accounts more effectively, increasing overall efficiency.

Question 58
Which of the following are to be determined to estimate current market demand?A. Total Market PotentialB. Area Market PotentialC. Analyse past SalesD. Sales force’s InputE. Market ShareChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C and E only
  • B.B, D and E only
  • C.A, C and D only
  • D.A, B and E only
Correct Answer: A, B and E only

To estimate current market demand, Marketing executives want to estimate total market potential, area market potential, and total industry sales and market shares.

 

Total Market Potential: It is the maximum sales available to all firms in an industry during a given period, under a given level of industry marketing effort and environmental conditions.

 

Area Market Potential: Because companies must allocate their marketing budget optimally among their best territories, they need to estimate the market potential of different cities, states, and nations. Two major methods are the market-buildup method, used primarily by business marketers, and the multiple-factor index method, used primarily by consumer marketers.

 

Industry Sales and Market Shares: Besides estimating total potential and area potential, a company needs to know the actual industry sales taking place in its market. This means identifying competitors and estimating their sales.

Question 59
Which of the following are social factors influencing consumer’s behaviour?A. CultureB. Social classC. GroupsD. FamilyE. Roles and statusChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, D and E only
  • B.B, C, D and E only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.B and C only
Correct Answer: C, D and E only

Option C is the correct answer.

 

Consumer behaviour is the study of how individuals, groups, and organizations select, buy, use, and dispose of goods, services, ideas, or experiences to satisfy their needs and wants.

 

A consumer’s buying behaviour is influenced by cultural, social, and personal factors. Of these, cultural factors exert the broadest and deepest influence.

1. Cultural Factors: culture, sub-culture, social class

2. Social Factors: reference groups, family, and social roles and statuses affect our buying behaviour.

3. Personal Factors: age and stage in the life cycle, occupation and economic circumstances, personality and self-concept, and lifestyle and values.

Question 60
Which of the following are true when an organization uses intensive distribution of its products?A. Customers are moderate in number.B. Widespread market coverageC. Customers are brand-consciousD. Mass advertisingE. Pleasant shopping conditionsChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, D and E only
  • B.A, B and C only
  • C.B and D only
  • D.B, C and D only
Correct Answer: B and D only

Option C is the correct answer.

 

Intensive distribution places the goods or services in as many outlets as possible. This strategy serves well for snack foods, soft drinks, newspapers, candies, and gum—products consumers buy frequently or in a variety of locations.

 

The correct answer is option (C) - B and D.

 

B. Widespread market coverage: Intensive distribution involves making a product available in as many outlets as possible, achieving widespread market coverage.

 

D. Mass advertising: Intensive distribution often involves mass advertising to promote the availability of the product across a wide range of outlets.

Question 61
As per RTI Act, 2005, which of the following are exempted from disclosure [U/S 8(1)]?a. Information, the disclosure of which cause a breach of privilege of Parliament or the State Legislature.b. The monthly remuneration received by employee.c. Information received in confidence from foreign government.d. Information which relates to personal information the disclosure of which has no relationship to any public activity or interest.e. A statement of the categories of documents that are held by public authority or under its control.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a, b and e only
  • B.a, c and d only
  • C.c, d and e only
  • D.b, c and d only
Correct Answer: a, c and d only

Under Section 8(1) of the RTI Act, 2005, certain categories of information are exempted from disclosure. These include:

- Information, the disclosure of which cause a breach of privilege of Parliament or the State Legislature.

- Information received in confidence from foreign government.

- Information which relates to personal information the disclosure of which has no relationship to any public activity or interest.

 

On the other hand, options b is not exempted from disclosure under Section 8(1) of the RTI Act, 2005. The monthly remuneration received by an employee is generally considered to be in the public interest and therefore subject to disclosure.

 

As per Section 4 of the RTI Act, every public authority shall publish within one hundred and twenty days from the enactment of this Act, a statement of the categories of documents that are held by it or under its control, which means option e is also not under exempted category.

 

Therefore, option B is correct.

Question 62
An instrument is to be called ‘Negotiable’ as per Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, if it possesses which of the following characteristics?a. Can be transferred infinitum.b. Having minimum lock-in period.c. Freely transferable.d. The holder cannot sue in his own name.e. Holder’s title free from defects.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a, c and e only
  • B.a, b and e only
  • C.b, d and e only
  • D.a, b, c and e only
Correct Answer: a, c and e only

The Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881 defines a negotiable instrument as a promissory note, bill of exchange or cheque payable either to order or to bearer.

 

A negotiable instrument must possess the following characteristics:

 

a. Transferrable Infinitum: The instrument must be transferable by delivery or by endorsement and delivery, and the transferee must have the same rights as the transferor.

 

b. Time Period: There is no requirement of any minimum lock-in period for a negotiable instrument.

 

c. Freely Transferable: The instrument must be freely transferable, meaning it can be transferred without any restrictions.

 

d. The holder can sue in his own name: The holder of a negotiable instrument can sue in his own name.

 

e. Holder’s Title Free from Defects: The holder of a negotiable instrument must have a good title to it and the title of the holder must be free from any defects.

 

Therefore, among the given options, option A mentions the correct characteristics of a negotiable instrument.

Question 63
Intellectual Capital of an enterprise includes its:A. ProcessesB. DesignsC. Relationships developed with its customers and suppliers.D. Internet domain names.E. CopyrightsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C and D only
  • B.B, C and E only
  • C.C, D and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

All are considered as intellectual capital of an enterprises.

 

Intellectual capital refers to the intangible assets of a company that contribute to its overall value and competitiveness. These assets can include things like the knowledge and skills of employees, patents, trademarks, and other forms of intellectual property.

Question 64
Income received and accrued or arisen outside India from a business controlled in or a profession set up in India, is taxed in the hands of which of the following?a. Every citizen of Indiab. Domicile of Indiac. Ordinary Residentd. Non-Ordinarily Residente. Non-ResidentChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a and c only
  • B.a and b only
  • C.c and d only
  • D.c, d and e only
Correct Answer: c and d only

Tax liability of an assessee varies with his residence or residential status. Hence, the first inquiry should be about residence of the assessee. Once the residential status of a person is determined in accordance with Sec 6 of the Income-Tax Act, the income chargeable to tax as part of total income shall be identified as follows under Sec 5.

 

Particulars

Resident

Resident but not Ordinarily resident

Non-resident

Income received or deemed to be received in India whether accrued in India or outside India.

Taxable

Taxable

Taxable

Income accruing or arising or deemed to accrue or arise in India whether received in India or outside India.

Taxable

Taxable

Taxable

Income earned and received outside India, from business controlled from India or Profession set up in India.

Taxable

Taxable

Not Taxable

Income earned and received outside India, from business controlled in or Profession set up outside India.

Taxable

Not Taxable

Not Taxable

Income which accrue or arises outside India and received outside India during the year preceding the previous year and remitted to India during the previous year

Not Taxable

 

Not Taxable

 

Not Taxable

 

 

Therefore, income received and accrued or arisen outside India from a business controlled in or a profession set up in India is taxable in the hands of (i) Resident and (ii) Resident but not ordinarily resident. Therefore, option C is correct.

Question 65
Which of the following are related to tax-evasion?a. Claiming bogus expenses and losses.b. Hiding capital nature of profits.c. Showing sales transactions.d. Showing excess transactions.e. Showing real income and expenses.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a and b only
  • B.a, b and d only
  • C.a, b and c only
  • D.c and e only
Correct Answer: a, b and d only

Tax-evasion refers to the illegal practice of not reporting or under-reporting taxable income to avoid paying taxes.

 

The option a and option b are related to claiming false or exaggerated expenses and hiding the true nature of profits to reduce the tax liability.

 

Option d is also related to tax evasion, as it involves showing more transactions than actually occurred to inflate the expenses and reduce the tax liability.

 

On the other hand, option c refers to showing legitimate sales transactions, which is not related to tax evasion.

 

Option e is also not related to tax evasion, as it refers to showing actual income and expenses, which is the legal way of reporting taxable income.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option B.

Question 66
Which of the following conditions should be fulfilled by anAssesseeto avail deduction u/s. 91 of Income Tax Act. 1961?a. TheAssesseeis a tax resident in India during the relevant previous year.b. The income accrues or arises to him/her outside India.c. There is an agreement for relief from double taxation between India and the other country when the income has accrued or arisen.d. TheAssesseehas paid tax on his/her foreign income in the foreign country.e. India does not have any agreement for relief from double taxation with the country.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:
  • A.a and e only
  • B.b and c only
  • C.a, b, d and e only
  • D.a, b and e only
Correct Answer: a, b, d and e only

Relief under section 90 and Section 91 of Income Tax Act, 1961: If a person who is resident in India in any previous year, in respect of his income, accrued or arose outside India has paid tax on such income in any country outside India, he shall be entitled to deduction from the Income Tax payable by him of a sum calculated on such doubly taxed income:

 

  • Under section 90 if the country in which tax is paid has entered double taxation avoidance agreement with the Government of India.
  • Under section 91 if the country in which tax is paid has not entered into any agreement with the Government of India.

 

Therefore, option C is correct.

Question 67
Match List IwithList II:List I (COP 27)A. MitigationB. CapitalizeC. TechnologyD. Capacity BuildingList II (COP 27 Action Plan)I. Promote climate know-how solutions.II. Empowering all stakeholders to engage in climate action.III. Phase down unabated coal power.IV. Creation of “loss and damage fund”Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- II, B- III, C- IV, D- I
  • B.A- IV, B- III, C- II, D- I
  • C.A- III, B- IV, C- I, D- II
  • D.A- IV, B- III, C- I, D- II
Correct Answer: A- III, B- IV, C- I, D- II

Option C is the correct answer.

Question 68
Match List IwithList II:List I (Issue)A. Cut-offB. ClassificationC. OccurrenceD. ExistenceList II (Description)I. Assets, Liabilities and Equity balances exist at the end of the period.II. Transactions and events have been recorded in proper accounts.III. Whether all assets and liabilities are reported in the appropriate period.IV. Transactions recognized in the financial statements have occurred and relate to the entity.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- II, B- I, C- III, D- IV
  • B.A- IV, B- III, C- II, D- I
  • C.A- I, B- III, C- II, D- IV
  • D.A- III, B- II, C- IV, D- I
Correct Answer: A- III, B- II, C- IV, D- I

LIST I (Issue) - LIST II (Description)

 

A. Cut-off - Whether all assets and liabilities are reported in the appropriate period.

B. Classification - Transactions and events have been recorded in proper accounts.

C. Occurrence - Transactions recognized in the financial statements have occurred and relate to the entity.

D. Existence - Assets, Liabilities and Equity balances exist at the end of the period.

Question 69
Match List IwithList II:List IA. Margin of SafetyB. Break Even PointC. P V RatioD. ContributionList III. Profit × sales/PV RatioII. Difference between total revenue and total variable costsIII. Total Sales-Total Variable Cost / Total SalesIV. Equality between contribution and total fixed costs.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- I, B- II, C- III, D- IV
  • B.A- I, B- IV, C- III, D- II
  • C.A- III, B- I, C- II, D- IV
  • D.A- IV, B- I, C- II, D- III
Correct Answer: A- I, B- IV, C- III, D- II

Margin of Safety is the excess of actual or expected sales over the break-even sales. It is calculated by dividing the margin of safety by the actual or expected sales.

 

Break-even point is the point where total revenue equals total costs, and the company makes neither a profit nor a loss. It is the point at which the contribution equals the fixed costs.

 

P V Ratio is the ratio of contribution to sales, expressed as a percentage. It is calculated by dividing the contribution by the sales.

 

Contribution is the difference between total revenue and total variable costs. It is the amount that contributes towards covering the fixed costs and generating a profit.

 

Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

Question 70
Match List IwithList II:List IA. Finance LeaseB. Operating LeaseC. Sale and Lease backD. Direct leaseList III. The lessee and the owner of the equipment are two different entities.II. Lessee sells an asset for cash to a prospective lessor and then leases back the same assets.III. The lessor does not transfer all the risk and rewards incidental to the ownership of the assets.IV. The lessor transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to the ownership of the assets to the lessee.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- IV, B- III, C- II, D- I
  • B.A- IV, B- III, C- I, D- II
  • C.A- I, B- II, C- III, D-IV
  • D.A- I, B- II, C- IV, D- III
Correct Answer: A- IV, B- III, C- II, D- I

A finance lease (also known as a capital lease) is a type of lease where the lessee (the party leasing the asset) has substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of the asset. This means that the lessee is responsible for maintaining the asset, paying for insurance and taxes, and bears the risk of any residual value at the end of the lease term. Therefore, option A. corresponds to IV.

 

An operating lease is a type of lease where the lessor (the party leasing the asset) retains ownership of the asset and bears the risks and rewards incidental to ownership. The lessee pays rent for the use of the asset but is not responsible for maintaining the asset or paying for insurance and taxes. Therefore, option B. corresponds to III.

 

Sale and leaseback is a transaction in which the owner of an asset sells the asset to a buyer and then leases it back from the buyer. This allows the owner to raise cash by selling the asset while still being able to use it. Therefore, option C. corresponds to II.

 

Direct lease is a type of lease in which the lessee leases an asset directly from the lessor. This is in contrast to a sale and leaseback transaction, where the lessee sells an asset to a buyer and then leases it back. Therefore, option D. corresponds to I.

Question 71
Match List IwithList II:List I (Type of Test)A.Kruskal-Wallis testB. Z-testC. ANOVA testD. Chi-square testList II (Subject matter of the problem)I. Parametric test to compare means of more than two population groups.II. Non-parametric test to compare means of more than two population groups.III. Non-parametric test to test the goodness of fit.IV. Testing the difference between means of two sample groups.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- II, B- IV, C- I, D- III
  • B.A- II, B- III, C- IV, D- I
  • C.A- III, B- I, C- II, D- IV
  • D.A- I, B- II, C- III, D-IV
Correct Answer: A- II, B- IV, C- I, D- III

A. Kruskal-Wallis test – II. Non-parametric test to compare means of more than two population groups.

B. Z-test – IV. Testing the difference between means of two sample groups.

C. ANOVA test – I. Parametric test to compare means of more than two population groups.

D. Chi-square test – III. Non-parametric test to test the goodness of fit.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is options are A- II, B- IV, C- I, D- III.

Question 72
Match List IwithList II:List I (Characteristic)A. Source of powerB. Concept of powerC. Dominant needD. Managing styleList II (Leadership Mode)I. Power extensionII. EmpowermentIII. Building cultureIV. MultiplyingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- II, B- IV, C- I, D- III
  • B.A- IV, B- II, C- I, D- III
  • C.A- II, B- IV, C- III, D-I
  • D.A- II, B- III, C- I, D- IV
Correct Answer: A- II, B- IV, C- I, D- III

Option A is the correct answer.

 

A - Source of power – Empowerment: Empowerment focuses on sharing power and authority with others, enabling them to make decisions and take actions on their own.

 

B - Concept of power – Multiplying: Multiplying refers to the ability to create more leaders and increase the overall leadership capacity within an organization or group.

 

C - Dominant need – Power extension: Power extension focuses on increasing one's own power and control within a given situation or organization.

 

D - Managing style – Building culture: Building culture refers to creating a positive and inclusive work environment that supports and empowers individuals to reach their full potential.

Question 73
Match List IwithList II:List I (Application narratives)A. Time interval between successivearrivalof customers in a queue.B. Distribution of income, property and certain human abilities in a capitalistic society.C. Movement of stock prices and distributing of income in a socialistic society.D. Distribution of rare events i.e. the probability of occurrence is very small but the number of trials are very large.List II (Statistical distributions)I. Pareto distributionII. Poisson distributionIII. Exponential distributionIV. Lognormal distributionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A- II, B- IV, C- III, D- I
  • B.A- III, B- I, C- IV, D- II
  • C.A- I, B- IV, C- II, D- III
  • D.A- I, B- II, C- III, D- IV
